EXAMPLE.default: the default value of the interface option. Boolean for checkboxes, strings for text inputs (string settings)
EXAMPLE.description: Disable clipboard event detection (onCut/onCopy/onPaste) via Javascript
warnings: text entries with warnings about broken features. May link references as (reference) or [reference title](reference id)
references are listed with [1] title where title is linked, or [2] url, if title was null.
the title in the reference list is the default for the (reference) syntax in warning/description strings

clipboardevents.description: Disable clipboard event detection (onCut/onCopy/onPaste) via Javascript
warnings: Disabling clipboard events breaks Ctrl+C/X/V copy/cut/paste functionaility in JS-based web applications (Google Docs...)

mozdocs: Mozilla Documentation for the clipboardevents setting

referer_spoof_source.description: Send a referer header with the target URI as the source. See the (bugzilla) or [pyllyukko's github issue](github) for more information.
warnings: Spoofing referers breaks functionality on websites relying on authentic referer headers
Spoofing referers breaks visualisation of 3rd-party sites on the Lightbeam addon
Spoofing referers disables CSRF protection on some login pages not implementing origin-header/cookie+token based CSRF protection

disk_cache.description: Disable the disk cache to reduce browsing data on your pc
warnings: This will slow down your browsing and increase the amount of transferred data.

useragent.description: Change your useragent string. If you keep the field empty, no setting will be changed.
warnings: If you're faking a non-mozilla UA some sites may break, because they are sending content adapted to the wrong browser.
